gurmukhi: jYsy sukdyv ky jnm smY jw ko jw ko jnm BieE qy skl isiD jwnIAY
transliteration: Jaisay Soukadayv Kay Janam Samai Jaa Ko Jaa Ko , Janam Bhaiao Tay Sakal Sidhi Jaaneeai ?
translation: According to a story in Mahabharat, everyone born at the time of the birth of sage Sukdev is considered divine and liberated.

gurmukhi: s√çwNqbUMd joeI joeI prq smuMdR ibKY sIp kY sMjog mukqwhl bKwnIAY
transliteration: Svaantaboond Joee Joee Parat Samoundr Bikhai , Seep Kai Sanjog Moukataahal Bakhaaneeai ?
translation: Every drop of rain that falls in the sea during the Nakshatra of Swati is believed to become a pearl when it comes in contact with an oyster.

gurmukhi: bwvn sugMD sMbMD paun gaun krY lwgY jwhI jwhI dRum cMdn smwnIAY
transliteration: Baavan Sougandh Sanbandh Paoun Gaoun Karai , Laagai Jaahee Jaahee Droum Chandan Samaaneeai ?
translation: When wind blows touching the sandalwood trees, it spreads its fragrance among all the trees who also start smelling like Sandalwood.

gurmukhi: qYsy gurisK sMg jo jo jwgq AMmiRq jog sbdu pRswid moK pd prvwnIAY ]361]
transliteration: Taisay Gursikh Sang Jo Jo Jaagat Anmrit Joga , Sabadu Prasaadi Mokh Pad Paravaaneeai ?361?
